column1: Country Code: +55International Call Prefix: 00 then Carrier CodeTrunk Prefix: 0 then Carrier Code
This page contains a list of area codes in Brazil for telephone dialling. The area codes are distributed geographically
column2: citing the main cities in each area.

column1: Local phone numbers in Brazil observe an eight-digit pattern (nnnn-nnnn) for landlines and nine digits (nnnnn-nnnn) for mobile phones. Mobile numbers share the same geographic area codes as landlines
column2: but the first digit differentiates them. Landline numbers start with digits 2 through 5. Initial digits 6 through 9 are reserved for mobile numbers
column3: but as of 2017 all mobile numbers in Brazil start with the digit 9. (There is an exception for some iDEN mobile lines operated by Nextel
column4: which are eight digits long and start with 7.)

column2: and are often notated between parentheses: (aa) nnnn-nnnn. For long-distance calls within Brazil
column3: a zero (0) must be dialed first
column4: then a carrier selection code (for example
column5: 21 for Embratel and 41 for TIM Brasil)
column7: then the local number. For example
column8: to call the number 2222-2222 in Fortaleza (area code 85) using Oi (selection code 31) as the chosen carrier

column2: the international access code used in the calling country must be dialed (for example
column3: 011 from the United States and Canada
column4: 00 from Europe and most other countries
column5: or the actual "+" sign from some mobile networks)
column8: then the local eight- or nine-digit number. For example
column9: to call the number 3333-3333 in Rio de Janeiro (area code 21) from Europe

== 6 Central-West Region and states of Tocantins
61 – entire Federal District (Brasília) and surrounding area of Goiás state
63 – entire State of Tocantins (capital city Palmas)
67 – entire State of Mato Grosso do Sul (capital city Campo Grande)
68 – entire State of Acre (capital city Rio Branco)
69 – entire State of Rondônia (capital city Porto Velho)
78 – reserved (formerly used by Embratel for maritime telecommunications and for the RENPAC dialled data communication system)
79 – entire State of Sergipe (capital city Aracaju)
82 – entire State of Alagoas (capital city Maceió)
83 – entire State of Paraíba (capital city João Pessoa)
84 – entire State of Rio Grande do Norte (capital city Natal)
== 9 North Region and the state of Maranhão ==
95 – entire State of Roraima (capital city Boa Vista)
96 – entire State of Amapá (capital city Macapá)

column2: some area codes span state borders to cater for tightly integrated interstate communities:

column1: Two villages straddle the Preto river on the Minas Gerais–Rio de Janeiro state border. So
column2: the village of Maringá (not to be confused with the homonymous large city in the State of Paraná) lies partly in the Rio de Janeiro municipality of Itatiaia and partly in the Minas Gerais municipality of Bocaina de Minas
column3: while the village of Porto das Flores is divided between the municipalities of Rio das Flores (Rio de Janeiro) and Belmiro Braga (Minas Gerais). Both sides of these villages use the Rio de Janeiro area code 24. Outside these villages
column4: their respective Minas Gerais municipalities use the proper regional area code 32.

column1: Two border cities in the State of Paraná are contiguous with larger cities in Santa Catarina and use area codes from the latter state: Rio Negro (contiguous with Mafra) uses area code 47
column2: and Barracão (contiguous with Dionísio Cerqueira) uses area code 49.
the border city of Porto União in the State of Santa Catarina is contiguous with the larger Paraná city of União da Vitória and uses the latter state's area code 42.

column1: The cities of Barão de Grajaú and Alto Parnaíba
column3: are respectively conurbated with Floriano and Santa Filomena
column5: and use the latter state's area code 89 for landlines. Most local mobile phones in Alto Parnaíba
column7: use Southern Maranhão area code 99. Also in Maranhão
column9: which is next to the Piauí capital city of Teresina
column10: formerly used northern Piauí area code 86
column11: but now it uses the Maranhão area code 99.
